sentences: Edis Görgülü (born 28 November 1990) is a Turkish singer and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He was born in London and raised in İzmir.
section: N/A

sentences: While studying at high school and university, he passed music lessons.
section: N/A

sentences: After enrolling in Galatasaray University Communication Faculty, he settled in Istanbul and immediately tried to contact various people to make an album, but he did not succeed.
section: N/A

sentences: Meanwhile, he started acting and had roles in TV series Dinle Sevgili (2011–12) and Hayatımın Rolü (2012).
section: N/A

sentences: In the years that he pursued a career in acting, he got an offer from his manager to make an album.
section: N/A

sentences: After releasing numerous singles, Edis released his first studio album Ân in March 2018.
section: N/A

sentences: His first single "Benim Ol", which was released in March 2014, was a successful hit and ranked number two on Türkçe Top 20.
section: N/A

sentences: His subsequent singles "Dudak" (2016) and "Çok Çok" (2017) also ranked number two on the charts followed by "Roman", which became a number-one hit.
section: N/A

sentences: Music critics have praised Edis's style.
section: N/A

== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings =
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Edis Görgülü was born on 28 November 1990 in London, England.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Prior to his birth, his parents had moved to London to work and finish their studies.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: His mother worked in a café while his father got a job in BBC Radio.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: He is part Azerbaijani through his mother, who was born in Baku.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: While Edis was two years old, his parents decided to bring him up in Turkey and moved to İzmir.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Edis took piano lessons at the age of four.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: After learning piano, he started to sing as well.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: He subsequently attended İzmir Özel Tevfik Fikret High School.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2007 he got involved in a project on behalf of his school to promote İzmir as a candidate for Expo 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: He then became a soloist in İzmir Kent Orchestra.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: He later told his family that he wanted to become a musician, but they told him that he needed to finish his studies first.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: After getting enrolled in Galatasaray University Communication Faculty, he settled in Istanbul.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Meanwhile, he got a place in Istanbul University State Conservatory and pursued his studies there as well.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: As he was unable to handle studying at two schools, he left Istanbul University.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: In Istanbul he tried to contact various people to help him make an album, but he did not succeed.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Eventually he started to work with acting agencies.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2011–12, he portrayed the character of Barış in Fox TV's series Dinle Sevgili, followed by another role in 2012 as Uygar in Star TV's series Hayatımın Rolü.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: During his acting years, he went to a club with his friend and while he was singing to a song during a karaoke, he caught the attention of his manager and friends.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: The manager subsequently offered him to work on a new album.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: Through his manager Şebnem Özberk, he met with Kenan Doğulu for the first time and recorded various demos.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===

sentences: He then met Ozan Çolakoğlu and Soner Sarıkabadayı.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2013: Early years and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: 2014–present: Singles and Ân =
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===
== Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: After meeting Ozan Çolakoğlu and Soner Sarıkabadayı, Edis signed a contract with PDND Müzik to work on an album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: He then listened to numerous songs prepared by Çolakoğlu and Sarıkabadayı.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Eventually "Benim Ol" was chosen as Edis's first single.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Edis himself wrote the lyrics for "Benim Ol", and the single was released on 1 December 2014 by PDND Müzik.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Hepsi member Cemre Kemer appeared in the music video for "Benim Ol".
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: The song was played in Turkey's radio and television and ranked number two on Türkçe Top 20 for three weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Edis appeared as a guest on 3 Adam, Güldür Güldür Show and İşte Benim Stilim to promote his new song and later performed at the opening ceremony of the 42nd Golden Butterfly Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: From 30 March to 6 April 2015 Edis was the most searched name on Google in Turkey.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Edis's performances, songs and dance style were praised by the critics.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Ali Tufan Koç of Hürriyet called Edis the "sought fresh blood" in music industry.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: From 31 March to 1 April, Edis donated parts of his property to Cancer-Free Life Association.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: The income from the sale of these items was used to support the treatment of children with cancer.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: On 2 May he performed at the Bostancı Show Center alongside Soner Sarıkabadayı.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: On 19 May, he performed at a concert in Sultangazi during which some fans tried to get close to him and the scene almost collapsed.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: As a result, the concert finished earlier than planned.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: On 10 July, his second single "Olmamış mı?" was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In January 2016, his song "Vay" appeared on the soundtrack of the movie Her Şey Aşktan and in August his new single "Dudak" ranked number two on the music charts in Turkey.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In October, he appeared in a commercial for the retailer Defacto.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: By the end of 2016, he signed a new contract with DMC, and PDND's owner Soner Sarıkabadayı sued him for violating his contract with his company requesting ₺30,000.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Edis's fifth single "Çok Çok" was released in June 2017 by DMC and Felix.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: The song ranked second on Turkey's music charts and was nominated for the Best Clip and the Song of the Year awards at the 44th Golden Butterfly Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In December his concert was streamed online, and Fatma Turgut and Ozan Çolakoğlu appeared on the stage as well.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Edis's first studio album Ân was released in March 2018 by DMC.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Its lead single, "Roman", ranked number one on Turkey's music charts for four weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Three other music videos from the album were released for the songs "Yalan", "Ân" and "Bana Ne" respectively.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: Meanwhile, Edis became a spokesman for United Nations Population Fund in Turkey and signed a ₺1 million contract with the brand Yedigün to appear in their commercials.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: He was one of the artists whose name appeared in Yıldız Tilbe's tribute album Yıldızlı Şarkılar and performed the song "Buz Kırağı".
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: He also released a duet with Emina Jahović in July 2018, titled "Güzelliğine".
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: According to Telifmetre, Edis was the third male artist with the most number of streams on radio and television in 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In early 2019, it was announced that Edis was working on a promotional song for Mastercard Turkey.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: The song, titled "Paha Biçilemez Bir Şey Başlat", was released in February 2019 together with a music video for which a city bus was used.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: After signing a contract with Head & Shoulders, Edis wrote and prepared the single "Efsane Sensin" together Onurr.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: The song, which was produced by Ozan Çolakoğlu, was released in May 2019 with an accompanying music video directed by Gülşen Aybaba.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In October 2019, Edis's former management company sued him, demanding ₺3.5 million in damages, stating that Edis had refused to pay them their fair share following the conclusion of his concerts and before terminating his contract with them.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: On 1 December 2019, Edis marked the fifth year of his career with a concert at the Volkswagen Arena Istanbul.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: For the event, titled Ân'a Veda, Edis worked with a group of 49 people and performed a new rap song on stage.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In April 2020, his single "Perişanım", which featured elements of pop and urban, was released by Palm & DMC on digital platforms.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===

sentences: In August, his duet with Gülşen, titled "Nirvana", was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–present: Singles and Ân ===
== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Edis can play guitar and piano but does not consider himself a professional instrumentalist.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: His first single "Benim Ol" is said to have classical elements, and Onur Baştürk of Hürriyet considers it similar to the songs of 1990s.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Edis wrote his first song at the age of ten "just to attract interest".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: As he grew older he worked on the lyrics again and considers his attempts to write a song successful.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He is a fan of Freddie Mercury, Michael Jackson, Sezen Aksu and Tarkan.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: During his childhood he mostly listened to Barış Manço, Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: After listening to Sting's "Desert Rose" he decided to include elements of both Western and Eastern music in his work.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In terms of fashion, Edis sees himself as a bit prejudiced and chooses famous brands more often.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He thinks a lot about his style and cares about looking good.
section: == Artistry ==
